fields.description:
Many of our users use jira in the following way:
* They open their favourite dasboard 
* choose an issue from an filter
* work on that issue
* After the work is finished, they want to return to their favourite dashboard. Now they see the issue breadcrumb and want to go to their starting point (the favorite dashboard). But the breadcrumb only offers:

_'project' - 'main issue' - 'sub jissue'_

* They click on 'project' and now they are at an unexpected place (project summary) and get confused. (the 'dasboard' link is often not visible)

*It would be better if the breadcrumb would start with the last used (favorite) dashboard:*

_*'last used dashboard'* - 'project' - 'main issue' - 'sub jissue'_
fields.summary: issue-breadcrumb should start with the last used Dashboard

fields.description:
+*TECHNICAL DESCRIPTION*+

*ASSUMPTION-01:* Screen = Issue Navigator
*ASSUMPTION-02:* Sort = By the Number Field required to change (e.g. Rank field)

*LIMITATIONS:* Be able to do this in JIRA and NOT Greenhopper


IN THE ISSUE NAVIGATOR SCREEN (which displays a list of Provide ability to modify an Issue's "Number Field" type field by having an "Up" and "Down" arrow, along with a field to type in Rank value.

----

*UP AND DOWN ARROWS*

The Up and Down value with will exchange the Rank value of the issue and the Rank value of the upper issue (in the case of a user clicking on the UP arrow), or the Rank Value of the lower issue (in the case of a user clicking on the Down arrow)

{quote}
e.g.

- Issue A has a Rank value of 5
- Issue B has a Rank value of 6

If user clicks on the UP arrow in of Issue B, then:

- Issue A Rank value will change to 6
- Issue B Rank value will change to 5

New List will be (assuming it's still sorted by Rank)

- Issue B / Rank 5
- Issue A / Rank 6
{quote}

----

*WRITE-IN FIELD*

The field to type in the Rank value will assign that entered value (X) for the Rank of the issue, and add (+1) to the Rank value of all issue below it (up to the issue.

{quote}
e.g.

- Issue A has a Rank value of 5
- Issue B has a Rank value of 6
- Issue C has a Rank value of 7
- Issue D has a Rank value of 8
- Issue E has a Rank value of 9
- Issue F has a Rank value of 10

If user enters "6" for the Rank of Issue E, then:

- Issue A Rank value will remain unchanged (5)
- Issue E Rank value (which used to be 9) will change to the entered value (6)
- Issue B Rank value (which used to be 6) will now be 6+1 = 7
- Issue C Rank value (which used to be 7) will now be 7+1 = 8
- Issue D Rank value (which used to be 8) will now be 8+1 = 9
- Issue F Rank value will remain unchanged (10)

New List will be (assuming it's still sorted by Rank)

- Issue A / Rank 5
- Issue E / Rank 6
- Issue B / Rank 7
- Issue C / Rank 8
- Issue D / Rank 8
- Issue F / Rank 9
{quote}

----

+*PRACTICAL DESCRIPTION*+

As an Executive, I want to be able to view a list (table view, Issue Navigator view (?)) of all open issues of the Development department, on a daily/weekly basis, and with my team, want to be able to rank the list.  Ranking the list should be by clicking on an UP or DOWN button within the issue line item, or be able to write in the desired Rank value and Save (which will refresh the list with the new Rank order)


{panel:title=ALTERNATIVELY and IDEALLY...| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE}
ALTERNATIVELY, and IDEALLY, I would like to be able to do this by dragging and dropping the line item in the desired position, and have the Rank value change accordingly
{panel} 

This will present the Development team with a Ranked list of issues to work off of, without having to question which issue to work on next.
fields.summary: Ability to change Number Field Value (such as Issue Rank) in a List View (such as Issue Navigator) by "Clicking Up / Down Arrow Images", "Writing In Value" or "Dragging and Dropping"

In version 4.0.1 of Jira (and probably in later versions) the complete list of Screens using a Field are shown in the Field Configuration. Since the Field configuration and Screens are related to a project, the Field Configuration should only show the screens that are related to that particular Configuration.

To clarify this a little more:
The field Affected Version/s is on almost every create issue Screen. We have several projects that have different Screen Schemes en Screens attached. The projects also have different Field Configurations related to them. If I choose the Field Configuration of one of the projects, all screens are shown that Affected Version/s is on. I'd like to see only the Screens related to the project here. It looks to me that the query used for creating the View Configuration Page should be altered for this. Please consider implementing this change.

Kind regards,

Johan-Kees Vliek
PinkRoccade Healthcare
fields.summary: Only show Screens that are related to selected Field Configuration

fields.description:
When you create a custom field and give it a description, that description correctly appears under the field on all applicable screens. However, if you "Edit Custom Field Details" and change the description, the change will not take effect. The new description can only be displayed if you:

* Go to System > Issue Fields > Field Configurations and open the proper field configuration.
* Find your custom field and edit its description (using the "Edit" link on the right of the field).

This is a request to automatically propagate the changes in custom field descriptions to the proper field configurations, so the change in any custom field details can be displayed.
fields.summary: Propagate a custom field description to the proper field configuration

fields.description:
JIRA does not reindex the issue when no fields changes are requested but it does update the updated date. This makes issue navigator disagree with issue views and SOAP. Originally reported as SOAP specific.

Happens also on Studio 2.2

The problem is described in details at https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLE-1112

To reproduce:
* Perform issue workflow action using SOAP (tested with 'stop progress' action) - time X
* Wait few minutes
* Perform empty 'update issue' SOAP call - time Y (and Y > X)
* Check the issue update time in UI (it reports time X)
* Check the issue update time in xml returned by search call like [that|https://studio.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?decorator=none&reset=true&tempMax=5000&&pid=10121&type=5&resolution=-1&priority=5&reporterSelect=specificuser&reporter=jgorycki&assigneeSelect=jjaroczynski] (it reports time X)
* Check the issue update time in xml returned by 'get issue details' call like [that|https://studio.atlassian.com/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/PLE-962/PLE-962.xml] (it reports time Y)

All the above calls should return the same 'update time'.
fields.summary: JIRA returns different 'updated time' for issue in some cases

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21889].
  {panel}

The new JIRA feature allowing customization of JIRA email notification subject lines is great.

The problem is nearly 100% of the time, we'd like to make a single customization of the subject line applicable to all notification types.  But to do so, we have to duplicate that custom .vm file about 15 times, once for each notification type.

It would be much more admin friendly to implement a single default .vm -- e.g. subject/default.vm -- that applies to all notification types unless a more specific .vm file is present overriding the default for a specific notification type.

i.e. only need 1 file -- subject/default.vm -- if that works for all your email notifications.  But if want issuecreated.vm to be a special case, you can provide that file also to override the default.
fields.summary: customizing email subject lines requires major duplication of effort -- implement a default .vm file with per-notification type files as optional overrides

*Original Description*
Why is it REQUIRED that I enter an email prefix when configuring an SMTP Server for JIRA? Rather presumptuous that all users want this.

For filtering in the email client, all my emails from JIRA are differentiated by the From address. I don't need (JIRA) or anything else prepended to every subject line. And furthermore, now that I can config custom subject lines per email notification type, I could always prepend whatever I want to each subject line in those Velocity templates including "(JIRA)" if I so wanted.

Please remove this requirement from defining the SMTP server.

The problem needs fixing in:
 - MailServerActionSupport.java doValidation() – remove check for isBlank(prefix)
 - remove "<ui:param name="'mandatory'">true</ui:param>" from updatesmtpmailserver.jsp
fields.summary: remove requirement for entering an email prefix in the SMTP Server config

fields.description:
For one of our projects, I have created two custom workflows, Simple and Testing. The Testing workflow scheme is a superset of the Simple workflow. The Testing workflow is associated with a Test Task issue type and Testing Activity sub issue type. Now the project manager wants to migrate certain existing Tasks and Sub-Tasks to the new issue task in order to take advantage of the new workflow.

Based on JRA-10167 and JRA-11229, Jira does not allow issue type changes when the workflow changes. However, this brute force solution to the original problems does not allow us to do what we want now.

My expectation is that Jira should allow issue type changes across all issue types. When the issue current Status is available in the destination issue type workflow only once then the migration to the new workflow can happen without intervention. If the status is available more than once (creating ambiguity) or not at all (creating an orphan) then Jira should prompt for how to map the states.

Similar behaviour should apply to bulk changes.

In the meantime we do have the option of creating a new workflow scheme with all issue types in the same workflow, migrating the project to that scheme, moving all the issue types we want and migrating the workflow scheme back. But this is a pretty painful workaround and I can guarantee that in the future some issue will be created with the wrong issue type and this workaround is too painful for regular use on a project with over a thousand issues on the go.
fields.summary: Cannot Change Issue Type to a Different but Compatible Workflow

Please add the ability to MERGE or APPEND when doing a Bulk Issue change and editing labels.

For example,

If I am working with a list of JIRA tickets that have 3 different labels and I want to add the label: peter_filias, it will remove all 3 labels and add peter_filias. I'd like to have the ability to do a BULK ADD of a label, for example.

I'd also like to have the ability to MOVE where the label field shows up when I am working with filters. I currently have to scroll halfway down my page to find the label field. It would be very helpful if you could customize the filter creation/editing order of elements in the left column.

fields.description:
In my case, the WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties included has these loggers turned off, but they still seem to run.  I am including a patch that ignores the NullPointerException following the pattern of ignoring the ClassNotFoundException.


Details below taken from:  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/NullPointerException+when+Switching+between+Projects+or+Boards

Symptoms
When switching between projects or boards using the "Agile" menu, an error like the following appears onscreen and in the logs:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor$CallStack.isProtectedAction(XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.afterExecutionImpl(XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.afterSuccessfulExecution(XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.ChainedSQLInterceptor.afterSuccessfulExecution(ChainedSQLInterceptor.java:70)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.afterExecution(SQLProcessor.java:552)



Cause
There is a known problem with JIRA and a particular logger that manifests itself when logging for the XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor is enabled. This problem manifests itself when switching from project to project or board to board using the "Agile" menu.

Resolution
By default, the logger that causes this problem is disabled. If you're experiencing this problem, please check your log4j.properties file and any additional log configuration files. Your log4j.properties file should contain lines like the following:

log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor = OFF
, xsrflog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor =
 false
fields.summary: NullPointerException when Switching between Projects or Boards

fields.description:
h2. Patch Vailable For JIRA 4.1.2

There is now a patch available for JIRA 4.1.2 customers.

It consists of the following files

[^jira-gadgets-plugin-4.1.2_JRA21876.jar]
 
[^JRA-21876-4.1.2-patch-instructions.txt]
 
[^JRA-21876-4.1.2-patch.zip]


NOTES : 

This patch also requires that you update the jira-gadgets-plugin that has been shipped with JIRA.

To update this bundled plugin you also need to place [^jira-gadgets-plugin-4.1.2_JRA21876.jar] into
'<JIRA_HOME>/plugins/installed-plugins'.  It will then be loaded and will override the 
version that is shipped with JIRA.

WINDOWS USERS : Do not use the built in Windows ZIP extractor to apply this patch!

By default it replaces all the files in a directory instead of merging the files in.
If this happens, JIRA will not be able to work correctly.  Use another zip tool such
as WinZip or 7-Zip.



How to apply this patch
==========================

Before applying the patch file, make a copy of your JIRA web application directory in case 
things go wrong.  This will allow you to more easily back out any changes.


If you are using the Standalone distribution of JIRA:

1. Download the file JRA-21876-4.1.2-patch.zip
2. Expand the zip file into  <jira_install_dir>/atlassian-jira/ overwriting the files there
3. Restart JIRA


If you are using the WAR distribution of JIRA:

1. Download the file JRA-21876-4.1.2-patch.zip
2. Expand the zip file to <jira_install_dir>/webapp overwriting the files there
3. Run 'build.sh clean' on unix or 'build.bat clean' on windows
4. Run 'build.sh' on unix or 'build.bat' on windows
5. Redeploy the JIRA web app into your application server


The patch zip file contains the following files :

Archive:  patch-JRA-21876/patches/JRA-21876-4.1.2-patch.zip
  Length      Date    Time    Name
---------  ---------- -----   ----
    10905  2010-08-01 16:52   WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/security/login/LoginManagerImpl.class
       44  2010-08-02 16:55   WEB-INF/classes/patches/JRA-21876.readme
---------                     -------
    10949                     2 files


See also http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1972


h2. The Problem Description

The problem is that we have an optimisation in the JIRA code that denies and authentication attempt if there is no user known to the system

{code}

        LoginInfo loginInfo = getLoginInfo(userName);
        if (loginInfo == null)
        {
            return false;
        }
{code}


We need to change this to handle this user case where users are lazily added on first authentication attempt.


{code}
        LoginInfo loginInfo = getLoginInfo(userName);
        if (loginInfo == null)
        {
            return true;
        }
{code}

Its a very simple fix in practice.  I have spoke to Spuddy and he is kosher that there are no extra security implications.

This came up from a support ticket I got. User imported a XML backup from JIRA 3.13 to JIRA 4.1.2 and realized that his workflow operations didn't work anymore. I found several post-functions from a deprecated code: FlushCachesFunction.
The workaround for the customer is really painfull and unpleasant, because it is necessary to create a draft of each workflow and edit each step at a time, deleting the post-function that is not working (screenshot attached).

The other option is to make a XML backup of your JIRA data, and scan and remove this post-function, and re-import it again.

fields.description:
The _order by_ option in JQL seems not to be used when generating xml, excel or printable.

At exporting or switching a searchRequestView to other vies based on xml/rss the sorting of the searchrequest (stored in the Database) is not used.
It is using default _key desc_.

The only workaround is to reorder the searchresult or adding something like *&sorter/field=status&sorter/order=ASC* at the searchrequest url.
(i) At this time the filter is marked as modified and the search query is placed into the url.

For searchrequest-xml it is similar, only works with s.th. like:
/app/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/10605/SearchRequest-10605.xml?tempMax=1000&sorter/field=status&sorter/order=ASC

The permanent link is not usable as you want to export "current view"-fileds.

This issue also affects the jira issues macro from Confluence too.
fields.summary: Exporting to xml, printable or excel views does not preserve the sorting set at the filter

fields.description:
This is a bit of an interesting workflow case we discovered today.  If a user creates a workflow with 2 steps that are not editable (via the jira.issue.editable step property) and transitions between the two steps then in theory none of the fields should be editable, since they can't be edited in the source step and destination step.  

If fields are added to the transition screen however they can happily be edited since the fields don't care about the source & destination workflow steps or if they are editable.

The CommentAssignIssueAction should probably check if both the source and destination workflow steps are editable and if both aren't then not show any fields on the transition screen.  Similarly the validateTransition method in the issue service should do the same check and throw an error.

Note however that both the source & destination steps have to be not editable for this to be the case!  If either the source or destination are editable, fields should still render and be editable (to allow users to assign when reopening/closing an issue for example).

This probably only affects a very small number of users who happened to configure their workflows this way.
fields.summary: Transitioning from a non-editable workflow status to another non-editable workflow status allows user to edit fields

fields.description:
There's a couple of improvements in the keyboard shortcuts module.  Namely:
* Plugin writers can now hide keyboard shortcuts from the shortcut help dialog by adding a {{hidden='true'}} attribute to the XML definition
* Plugin writers can overwrite existing keyboard shortcuts.  To do so they simply have to define a shortcut module which defines the same shortcut keys (i.e. the same <shortcut> section) and with a higher <order> field.
fields.summary: Document improvements for the keyboard shortcuts plugin module (READY TO PUBLISH)

fields.description:
I've been doing a migration from a Jira 4.0 server to a Jira 4.1.2 server.

Created a new VM, clean installation etc. and everything has been by the book so far - I was able to log into a vanilla installation, check plugins etc.

The problem comes in when I try to restore the XML data I exported from the 4.0 server.

The import exits with this error:
Error importing data: org.apache.commons.lang.exception.NestableException: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Action][id,18931][body,240040112 240040121 240040136 240040154 240040163 240040332 240040337 240040350 240040360 240040366 240040371 240040385 240040391 240040407 240040464 240040488 240040617 240040618 240040644 240040691 240040806 240040823 240040841 240040842 240040893 240040905 240041021 240041031 240041072 240041085 240041127 240041189 240041191 240041199 240041211 240041244 240041306 240041316 240041325 240041401 240041405 240041410 240041520 240041568 240041688 240041714 240041730 240041752 240041785 240041794 240041819 240041863 240041875 240041876 240041879 240041889 240041900 240041909 240041951 240041990 240042279 240042282 240042288 240042380 240042383 <snip>

Having checked to see if someone else has had this problem I saw that some people had issues with hidden/strange characters in the <body> field that caused this issue - however I couldn't find anything out of the ordinary in the field (except for some ^I, which iirc are Tab spaces?) which shouldn't be an issue.

On further investigation I realized that the field had more than 64000 lines. When I reduced the number or deleted the content of the field altogether the importer moves past this point until it hits the next large <body> field and crashes again.

Is there a limit to the size of the <body> filed that can be imported? Is there some way for me to correct or bypass this issue (without losing data)?

Cheers

Pierre
fields.summary: Jira XML restore fails on large <body> field

fields.description:
After [setting a project as a Read-Only|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Archiving+a+Project#ArchivingaProject-Makingaproject%27ReadOnly%27] project, user will be able to execute Workflow Transition that the user or the issue has met. 


This is reproduceable in JIRA 3.13.5, JIRA 4.0, JIRA 4.0.2, JIRA 4.1, JIRA 4.1.1. Here are the steps to reproduce this and as an example, the "Only Assignee will be able to execute this transition" Permission Condition is used:

# create a new project
# create a new workflow that has Transition's Condition:"Only Assignee will be able to execute this transition". Or used the default JIRA workflow called "jira".
# create an issue in the project and assigned it to a user
# create a new Permission Scheme that only has "Browse Project" permission is granted to users. Other permissions are empty. 
# associate the project with the new Permission Scheme created in step 4.
# login as the user that has issue assigned to him. The user are be able to execute the transition that has "Only Assignee will be able to execute this transition". If the project using the Default JIRA workflow called jira, the Assignee will be able see "Start Progress" or "Stop Progress".

\\
This problem still occurred even if no user is associated with any Project Roles in the project.
fields.summary: Workflow Transition is visible/executable to user if the issue/user has met the condition for the workflow transition in a "Read Only"  project

fields.description:
+*SHORT DESCRIPTION*+

While creating a Transition (be it a regular Transition, or a Common Transition), in the "Add Post Function To Transition" list (or wherever appropriate), I would like to be able to assign a (post function?) condition that, when this specific transition is clicked, it automatically assigns the issue to the step/status it was in PRIOR to the current  Step/Status





+*LONG DESCRIPTION WITH USER SCENARIO*+

Here is the description of the user experience I am trying to create:

*USERS*
- User01: Business Analyst
- User02: Graphic Artist
- User03: Software Engineer (Coder)

*STEPS/STATUSES*

*REGULAR TRANSITIONS*
- "New Item" (Regular Transition)
- "Graphics Work-In-Progress" (Regular Transition)
- "Coding Work-In-Progress" (Regular Transition)

*COMMON TRANSITIONS*
- "Need More Info" (Common Transition)
- "Back to Previous Status" (Common Transition)



# Business Analyst creates an Issue Ticket.  The ticket gets a status of "New Item"\\
\\
# Graphic Artist picks up the ticket by transitioning it to "Graphics Work-In-Progress".  Once it's at the "Graphics Work-In-Progress" step, there is a transition available that's called "Need More Info" (this is in the case of the Graphic Artist having clarification question from the Business Analyst in order to continue his work)\\
\\
# Graphic Artist HAS questions for Business Analyst, so clicks on the transition "Need More Info".  Once in this "Need More Info" status, there is a transition available that's called "Back to Previous" Status\\
\\
# Business Analyst opens the ticket, provides more information, and clicks on the transition "Back to Previous Status".  The ticket status will change from "Need More Info" to "Graphics Work-In-Progress" (which was the previous status the ticket was in)\\
\\
# Graphics Artist completed the work, and click on an available transition that's called "Ready for Coding"\\
\\
# A Software Engineer picks up the ticket by transitioning it to "Coding Work-In-Progress".  Once it's at the "Coding Work-In-Progress" step, there is a transition available that's called "Need More Info" (which is THE SAME Transition as mentioned in #2 above)\\
\\
# Coder has questions for Business Analyst, so clickes on the transition "Need More Infor".  Once in this "Need More Info" status, there is a transition available that's called "Back to Previous" status\\
\\
# Business Analyst opens the ticket, provides more information, and clicks on the transition "Back to Previous Status".  The ticket status will change from "Need More Info" to "Coding Work-In-Progress" (which was the previous status the ticket was in).

\\
   

The "Need More Info" and "Back to Previous" transitions should probably be "Common Transitions"

"Back to Previous" transition should have a post function condition of setting it back to the previous status the ticket was in.

In the current (4.1) version of JIRA's Post Function list, I do see an option for "Assign to last role member: Assigns the issue to the last user from the specified role that had this issue assigned before".  I'm just looking for an option that says something like "Assign to last Status"

I saw a request for something similar back in July 2007.  I'm hoping by now, 3 years later (July 2010) this simple feature has been added.
fields.summary: "Back to Previous Status" Condition on Transition

fields.description:
The look/layout of filters on the dashboard has taken a major step backwards in 4.2, seemingly taking many of the things disliked about the View Issues screen.

* The gap between rows seems excessive. This is partially because in 3.x the font size was smaller, the text was centered vertically in the row, and there were border lines between rows. The font is now larger, the borders are gone, and the centering has changed. This makes it seem like a large amount of wasted space, even though the number of rows on the screen seems about the same. This is all compounded by the loss of every-other-row shading. This is less about functionality and more about cosmetics. However, it strongly affects the next point...

* Horizontal scroll bars in filters are evil. In 3.x (and I believe 4.0), I can set up a filter to fill half the page, with 8 different fields (summary, key, various date fields for release management to different environments, etc.). This all fits without issue. However, in 4.2 - EAP, instead of sizing the fields to fit it adds scroll bars. If the filter runs off the screen vertically (which is easy to have happen, see above), you have to scroll vertically to get to the scrollbar, then scroll back up to view  whatever it is you were viewing. Worse, in the situation I describe (8 fields/columns), but the time you've scrolled over to view the 5-8th field (which is where the 'Action' dropdown would be as well), you've completely scrolled past the key/summary fields. With the loss of the cosmetic clues (borders between columns, wasted space, no row shading) you easily lose track of where you are. The scrolling completely defeats the whole "dashboard" concept: A large amount of info displayed compactly in a single view. 

Combine the above with the continued inability to change column order, and it is now nearly unusable for a heavily dashboard-based workflow.
fields.summary: Dashboard filter UI significantly handicapped

fields.description:
TO CUSTOMERS WHO MAY BE EXPERIENCING THIS ISSUE

This problem is caused because JIRA 4.2 add new entries into seraph-config.xml.

In the *parameters* section of seraph-config.xml a new login cookie key is defined:

{code}
   <init-param>
      <param-name>login.cookie.key</param-name>
      <param-value>seraph.rememberme.cookie</param-value>
    </init-param>
{code}

These addition lines controls the Remember Me functionality.

Customers who simply copy their old seraph-config.xml over the one that ships with JIRA will in effect *remove* this data.

Customers will then need to re-add these lines in order to get Remember Me functionality to work as expected.
fields.summary: Remember Me during login no longer works

fields.description:
XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor is dependent on the log level. If a customer has a setup that overrides the JIRA bundled log4j.properties, this interceptor will kick in at INFO level.

The following method of XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor does not work for GreenHopper:

line 233:
private Class getClassOfElement(final StackTraceElement element)
{
try

{ return Class.forName(element.getClassName()); }
catch (ClassNotFoundException e)

{ return e.getClass(); }
}

It will try to load the GreenHopper action class through the WebAppClassloader, which will result in a ClassNotFoundException (I assume since GH is loaded through OSGI). In return, the method is not found and the annotation check in line 161 will cause a NPE.

XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor will only fire once per request. Most paths in GreenHopper trigger an SQL UPDATE already on a setter, so before the regular action execution. That makes the problem hard to reproduce.

Path to reproduce:

1. Activate the logger for XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor in log4j.properties
2. Go to a GreenHopper view (any board)
3. Then select a different view through the main "Agile" dropdown.

This way, the Setter-Update-path is not triggered, the main action execution runs into the interceptor and a NPE is thrown.

This might potentially affect other plugins as well.
fields.summary: XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor causes NPE on GreenHopper

I would like ability to force a user to log time spend when moving an issue from "In progress" to "Resolved" status in the Task manager (GreenHopper).

It would be nice if one could select which fields needs to be complete before the transition is effected. Currently only "Resolution" is prompted for.

Regards
Eddie Carpenter
fields.summary: Defining required fields to be completed when moving issues from "In Progress" to "Resolved" in Task Manager (GreenHopper)

fields.description:
I am convinced JIRA user and preacher to others to use JIRA for some years.
Now my company is moving all projects from TFS to Git.
I see Git becoming more and more important, also for the industry (even for Microsoft centric software!).

You have great possibilities to maintain your source code even with comfortable hosting and UIs like [http://www.github.com] and [http://www.gitorious.com].

We are not the only ones to move to that great and powerful CVS!

Please implement support for Git. We have tried the Git plugin available at your plugin marketplace. It killed JIRA and we had to contact your support to solve the problem.

A native integration would be even more preferable than a plugin solution. Look at Github and Gitorious and you see the opportunities. You could merge projects, teams, activity streams too, not just the commits and the diffs.

Hope you consider this. JIRA always has been innovative, Git is too. JIRA and Git would make a great couple!
fields.summary: Git Integration into JIRA
Not able to render html format of email subject for Activity Stream RSS feed in Outlook

fields.description:
It would be really great if we could have the ability to 'soft delete' an issue with the ability to retrieve it in the future if we need to.  I would expect that this would work much like the 'Delete' feature within Confluence where there is a trash can that can be emptied by an Administrator.

I'm a big believer in trusting the team and keeping the system open to allow people do what they need while doing their work, but sometimes things happen and issues can get lost.  If we knew we had the ability to retrieve issues after soft deleting them it would be very helpful and would keep us from having to restrict the issue permissions.
fields.summary: Allow Soft Delete of Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21830].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to disable irrelevant gadgets that have no functional purpose in and installation and will only confuse users.

Examples would be the  
* Fisheye gadgets for sites that don't use Fisheye
* Bugzilla gadget for sites that weren't imported from Bugzilla
* Votes gadget for sites that don't do voting
* etc.

Creating a Do Not Show list should be relatively easy.

The alternative, removing underlying code components appears to be more problematic due to intertwining, hard coded links, etc.  This may be a longer term design goal.  Support ref [JSP-61501]
fields.summary: Ability to hide unwanted gadgets
Add a way to find filters you are subscribed to

fields.description:
Hi,

The feature request is to be able to split fix/affects versions in JIRA. 

Examples: 

- Consider an issue set to fix-for [3.5.3,3.6.x]. When I am ready to release 3.6.0 I need to split the existing 3.6.x into 3.6.0 (current 3.6.x resolved issues) and 3.6.x (current 3.6.x unresolved issues)

- Split a version into multiple (3.6.x -> [3.6.0,3.6.x]) without effecting any other fix for versions already associated with those issues

Cheers 
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Ability to split versions

fields.description:
currently the roadmap "bar" will display Red, Yellow or Green.   Our custom workflow has an additional state called "In-Test' which we would also like to reflect in this bar.  I have been unable to track down where I could set something like this.  

It seems that if you are allowing people to create custom work-flows, there should be similar support for states and how they are reflected in the roadmap panel?
fields.summary: Flexibility in controlling roadmap bar colors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21826].
  {panel}

Hello,
it would be nice to have the following feature. 

I would like to create the following two filters: 

-Issues created during the last calendar week
-Issues created during this calendar week 

Where "last calendar week" is monday to sunday of the past week it doesn't matter if I'm on day 1 or 2 of the current week. 

Today if I use the filter "created in the last week" it means created in the last 7 days that is not at all the same thing.  because each day of the actual week I get different figures.

I think it is quite a common need to have visibility on the last monday to sunday week and the actual monday to sunday week.
fields.summary: add "actual calendar week" and "last calendar week" filtering options

fields.description:
I need to close the issues that are resolved but not closed and left inactive.

I need to specify tickets closures and inactivity with Jelly scripts i.e.

1) Identify resolved tickets in specific projects that have had no response within 2 days and warn that these tickets will be closed in 2 days if they are not updated
2) Identify resolved tickets in specific projects that have had no response within 4 days and set them to closed and notify user

What we need to provide you to implement a Jelly service? I also need to find out what  the security issue  for Jelly is .

Thanks

.
fields.summary: need to implement a Jelly service

fields.description:
The email's subject will not change to English after the Default Language is changed to English. This is tested in JIRA 4.0, JIRA 4.0.2, JIRA 4.1.1 using Danish and Germany Language.


Here is the step to replicate this problem:
# Install a fresh JIRA instance using Danish language
# Then, create a new issues. The Email's Subject will be in Danish. 
# Change the Default Language to English (UK or US) via _Administration > Global Settings > General Configuration_
# Create a new issues. The Email's Subject is in Danish(Aktivitet oprettet) instead of English(Issue Created). Here is the screenshot for the Mail Queue:
!Screenshot-1.png!


\\
This problem is not re-produceable in JIRA 3.13.5.
fields.summary: Changing the Default Language to English does not affect the language used in the Email Subject
